text: Dean Hawkshaw (born 24 April 1997) is a Scottish footballer who plays for Airdrieonians. A midfielder, Hawkshaw has previously played in the Scottish Premiership for Kilmarnock, during which time he had a spell on loan at Stranraer. He has also played in the Juniors for Glenafton Athletic. ==Career== Hawkshaw made his league debut for Kilmarnock in August 2016 against Motherwell, being taken off after a clash of heads with Carl McHugh. McHugh was out of play for several months with a head injury,https://www.donegallive.ie/news/sport/221570/the-cruel-side-of-sport- carl-and-keith-face-long-lay-offs.html while Hawkshaw had a concussion.https://www.pressreader.com/uk/the-courier-advertiser-angus-and- the-mearns-edition/20160820/282497183074627 Hawkshaw was out for months with a later knee injury.https://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football- news/kilmarnock-v-celtic-team-news-9282694 He remained in and around the first-team under the management of both Lee Clark and Lee McCulloch, but dropped out of the squad under Steve Clarke. Hawkshaw was loaned to Stranraer in January 2018, and released by Kilmarnock at the end of the 2017–18 season. Hawkshaw made a trial appearance for Greenock Morton in a friendly against Forfar Athletic in July 2018. He signed for Junior side Glenafton Athletic in September 2018. Hawkshaw then moved to Scottish League One club Airdrieonians, and made his first league appearance for the club in a 1-0 win against Forfar on 23 March 2019.
